descript.abstract:
Transit Advantages allow buses to bypass congestion and provide more reliable travel times for transit users. They help buses stay on schedule and move more people quickly and effectively within congested corridors for minimal investment.
The line geometry for transit advantage segments was derived from NCompass Technologies' Street Centerline dataset. The Transit Advantages dataset identifies the location where transit vehicles are permitted to operate and mixed-traffic is prohibited or has limited access to operate. Transit Advantages have been categorized by type which includes: bus lanes, bus ways, commuter rail, HOT lanes, light rail, meter bypasses, online stations and shoulder lanes.
Information within this data layer is subject to change and may not be complete. Please refer to street signage and field conditions for the most accurate information.
descript.purpose: The Transit Advantages dataset identifies the location where transit vehicles are permitted to operate and mixed-traffic is prohibited or has limited access to operate within the Twin Cities Metropolitan area.
descript.supplinf: Twin Cities 7 County Metropolitan Area. This includes the counties of Anoka, Carver, Dakota, Hennepin, Ramsey, Scott and Washington in Minnesota.

timeperd.current: Includes all transit advantage segments at time of publication.

theme.themekey: transit, buses, segments, transit advantage, roads, transportation, right of way, ROW, right-of-way, light rail, dedicated

place.placekey: Twin Cities, Anoka County, Carver County, Dakota County, Hennepin County, Ramsey County, Scott County, Washington County

citeinfo.title: NCompass Technologies Street Centerline, Transit Routes

attracc.attraccr: The database is maintained by Metro Transit's Service Development Division. Attributes are updated annually by Metro Transit staff.

dataqual.complete: Information within this data layer is subject to change and may not be complete. Please refer to street signage and field conditions for the most accurate information. Data layer includes all transit advantage segments at time of publication.

horizpa.horizpar: Positional accuracy for transit advantage segments (line geometry) was derived from NCompass Technologies' Street Centerline dataset. Most line geometry is within the public road right-of-way, often near the center.

procstep.procdesc: This dataset was created by consulting various Minnesota Department of Transportation, Metro Transit Rail Operations and Metro Transit Engineering and Facilities databases to map transit advantage segments along the same line geometry as the NCompass Technologiesâ€™ Street Centerline dataset.

spdoinfo.mgmg3til: One layer for entire seven county region.

overview.eaover:
Line Attributes:
SEGID: A unique identification number for each transit advantagey segment.
ID: A unique identification string for each transit advantage segment.
TYPE: The physical construction of the transit advantage segment.
LOCATION: The main roadway where the transit advantage exists.
DESC_: A description of the transit advantage segment.
MODE: A system for carrying transit passengers described by specific right-of-way, technology and operational facilities. MB = bus, LRT = light rail transit, CRT = commuter rail transit.
NTD: This binary classification provides inventory of transit advantages found in the Reportable (fixed guideway) Segments (P-40) form of the National Transit Database (NTD) annual report.
MILES: The approximate length of a transit advantage segment in miles.
